BiblioData.Title: NANOSEMICONDUCTOR PARTICLE
BiblioData.Abstract: Provided is nanosemiconductor particles wherein the particle diameter distribution of a core section and the particle diameter distribution of shelled particles have a core-shell structure wherein the optical characteristics of nanoparticles, i.e., an optical element, are optimized. The nanosemiconductor particles have the core-shell structure composed of the core section and a shell section. The average particle diameter of the shelled particle is 100nm or less, and the variation coefficient of the particle diameter of the core section is within 30%.

Claims.P: 1. Nanosized semiconductor particles, wherein the semiconductor particles each have a core/shell structure comprising a core and a shell and the shelled particles exhibit an average particle size of not more than 100 nm and a coefficient of variation of core size distribution being not more than 30%.
2. The semiconductor particles as claimed in claim 1, wherein the shelled particles exhibit a coefficient of variation in particle size distribution of not more than 30%.

3. The semiconductor particles as claimed in claim 1 or 2, wherein the core is comprised of a composition including at least one element selected from the group consisting of B, C, N, Al, Si, P, S, Zn, Ga, Ge, As, Cd, In, Sb and Te.
4. The semiconductor particles as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 3, wherein the shell is comprised of a composition exhibiting a greater band gap than that of the core.
5. The semiconductor particles as claimed in any one of claims 1 to 4, wherein the core is comprised of silicon and the shell is comprised of silicon oxide.
